decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It then uses powerful control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to disrupt opponents while building towards its win conditions, which include big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes ways to find its key lands and threats efficiently, such as Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can deploy its powerful threats to overpower the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize graveyard recursion and sacrifice effects to quickly flood the board with creatures, triggering powerful synergies such as Vengevine and Bridge from Below. Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier help fill the graveyard while cards like Gravecrawler and Bloodghast benefit from being able to return from the graveyard easily. Goblin Bushwhacker can provide a strong finisher, while Walking Ballista offers versatile removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast, aggressive plays and graveyard shenanigans.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By using Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by drawing cards, manipulating the board state, and shutting down opposing strategies. Lightning Helix and Lightning Bolt provide additional removal and reach, while Snapcaster Mage offers flexibility and recursion. The manabase is carefully constructed to support the triple-color requirements of the cards in the deck.

The main concept of this UWx Midrange deck is to control the game through a mix of counterspells, removal, and tempo plays, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Geist of Saint Traft and Spell Queller. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its own threats, and close out the game quickly with a mix of burn spells and evasive creatures. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional threats and value in the mid to late game, allowing the deck to adapt to different board states and strategies.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy by playing low-cost Human creatures that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. Key cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant can quickly grow into massive threats, while disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan. With efficient mana sources like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient and aggressive Human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant provide disruption while pumping up the team. Noble Hierarch and Champion of the Parish help accelerate the board presence. Aether Vial allows for instant speed plays and Reflector Mage provides tempo advantage. The deck aims to curve out aggressively while using disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's game plan. The versatile creature base allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups.

The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board by utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay, while also applying pressure with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while generating value through cards like Liliana of the Veil and Kolaghan's Command. By combining disruption, removal, and aggressive creatures, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using low-cost, high-damage spells and efficient creatures to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, along with creature pressure from Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to deal consistent damage and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Boros Charm provide additional reach and disruption to help secure the win in the mid to late game.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures with disruptive abilities to apply early pressure on opponents. By combining mana acceleration with powerful creatures like Spell Queller and Knight of the Reliquary, it aims to control the board while maintaining a fast clock. Creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage disrupt opponent's game plan, while cards like Eternal Witness and Scavenging Ooze provide resilience and graveyard hate. The deck also has access to instant speed threats through Collected Company, allowing for surprise attacks and additional board presence.

The key concept of this Spirit Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence of flying Spirit creatures, utilizing cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain to buff them. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while Collected Company provides additional creature card advantage. With disruption cards like Spell Queller and Phantasmal Image for versatility, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive flying creatures while maintaining control of the board through tempo plays and efficient removal like Path to Exile.

This Spirit Aggro deck aims to quickly flood the board with flying spirits and take control of the game. By using cards like Aether Vial and Collected Company, the deck can deploy threats at instant speed and overwhelm the opponent. Drogskol Captain boosts the power of the spirits while providing hexproof, making them difficult to remove. Supreme Phantom further enhances the spirits, while cards like Spell Queller and Path to Exile provide disruption and removal options. The deck relies on its aggressive creatures and efficient spell suite to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this aggressive Goblin deck is to swarm the board with cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Goblin Guide, Legion Loyalist, and Reckless Bushwhacker, this deck aims to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent. Devastating Summons and The Flame of Keld provide additional finishers to close out the game. With a focus on speed and aggression, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Human creatures that benefit from each other's abilities. By using cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck's mana base is optimized to support a consistent and fast start, allowing the player to overwhelm their opponent with a swarm of powerful Human creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards that benefit from having a strong board presence, such as Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to quickly build up a lethal army of creatures. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter helps to control the opponent's plays while maintaining pressure on them. The use of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment and tempo advantage in the early game.

This aggressive Human deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient creature strategy. By utilizing powerful creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck can quickly build a threatening board presence. Cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage provide disruptive elements to control the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, keeping opponents off-guard. With a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Search for Azcanta, and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is designed to support the three-color casting requirements of the control spells, with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands. The win condition often comes from using Celestial Colonnade as a creature to finish off the opponent, while using board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Settle the Wreckage to keep the opponent's threats in check.
